channel.title: ops-class.org Lectures
channel.description: OS lectures and videos by Geoffrey Challen.

item.title: Exam Review
item.description: Exam review ask me anything session.

item.title: Hints for Computer System Design
item.description: Discussion of introduction to Hints for Computer System Design by Butler Lampson.

item.title: Amdahl's Law
item.description: Continuation of a discussion of performance and benchmarking, and introduction to Amdahl's Law.

item.title: Performance and Benchmarking
item.description: Discussion of the process of benchmarking and performance improvement.

item.title: Container Virtualization
item.description: Discussion of container or operating-system virtualization.

item.title: Xen and the Art of Virtualization
item.description: Discussion of the Xen approach to paravirtualization.

item.title: Full Virtualization
item.description: Introduction to virtualization.

item.title: RAID
item.description: Overview of Redundant Arrays of Inexpensive Disks (RAID).

item.title: Log-Structured File Systems
item.description: Discussion of log-structured file systems.

item.title: Journaling and FFS
item.description: The UNIX Fast File System (FFS).

item.title: File System Caching and Consistency
item.description: Discussion of file system caching and its impacts on consistency.

item.title: File System Data Structures
item.description: Continuation of a discussion of file system data structures.

item.title: Introduction to File Systems
item.description: Introduction to file system data structures and challenges.

item.title: Files
item.description: Introduction to files, file metadata and UNIX file system semantics.

item.title: Disks
item.description: Introduction to disks and the basics of stable storage.

item.title: Page Replacement
item.description: Discussion of page replacement policies.

item.title: Swapping
item.description: A discussion of how to swap in and out pages.

item.title: Paging
item.description: Page table design and implementation.

item.title: Page Translation
item.description: Discussion of page translation.

item.title: Address Translation
item.description: Discussion of efficiently translating virtual addresses to physical addresses.

item.title: Virtual Addresses
item.description: Discussion of creating and translating virtual addresses.

item.title: Introduction to Memory Management
item.description: Introduction to the challenge of OS energy management and the address space abstraction.

item.title: A Scheduling Story
item.description: Introduction to MLFQ, Con Kolivas, Linux development, and the Rotating Staircase Deadline Scheduler.

item.title: Simple Schedulers
item.description: An overview of simple schedulers including the know-nothings (random, round-robin) and oracle schedulers.

item.title: Introduction to Scheduling
item.description: Completion of a discussion of thread states followed by a motivation of the what, when and how of thread scheduling.

item.title: Threads and Thread Implementations
item.description: Introduction to the thread abstraction and discussion of different threading implementations.

item.title: Context Switching
item.description: The how and why of context switching.

item.title: Interrupt and Exception Handling
item.description: Introduction to the root of kernel privilege, interrupts and exception handling. Completion of wait and exit.

item.title: Deadlock and exec
item.description: Discussion of deadlock and completion of the process interface including a discussion of exec.

item.title: Synchronization Primitives
item.description: Spinlocks, locks, and condition variables.

item.title: Introduction to Synchronization
item.description: Introduction to synchronization and critical sections.

item.title: fork() and pipe()
item.description: Completion of a discussion of fork including the use of pipes.

item.title: Processes and File Handles
item.description: Introduction to file handles and file descriptors and the process life cycle.

item.title: More About Processes
item.description: Continuation of a discussion of the process abstraction.

item.title: The Process Abstraction
item.description: Introduction to the process abstraction and standard UNIX utilities.

item.title: ASST0 Setup
item.description: Getting starting with ASST0 and setting up the toolchain.

item.title: Introduction to CSE 421/521
item.description: Introduction to an introduction to operating systems, the course staff, and course policies.

item.title: Exam Review
item.description: Exam review ask me anything session.

item.title: Cells: A Virtual Mobile Smartphone Architecture
item.description: Discussion of Cells: A Virtual Mobile Smartphone Architecture by Jeremy Andrus et al.

item.title: Scaling Linux to Many Cores
item.description: Discussion of "An Analysis of Linux Scalability to Many Cores" by Silas Boyd-Wickizer et al.

item.title: Hints for Computer System Design
item.description: Continuation of a discussion of performance and benchmarking, followed by an introduction to Hints for Computer System Design by Butler Lampson.

item.title: Performance and Benchmarking
item.description: Discussion of the process of benchmarking and performance improvement.

item.title: Atlantis: Robust, Extensible Execution Environments for Web Applications
item.description: Discussion of the Atlantis paper by James Mickens and collaborators.

item.description: Discussion of the Xen approach to paravirtualization.

item.description: Introduction to virtualization.

item.description: Overview of Redundant Arrays of Inexpensive Disks (RAID).

item.description: Discussion of log-structured file systems.

item.description: Introduction to journaling and the UNIX Fast File System (FFS).

item.description: Discussion of file system caching and its impacts on consistency.

item.description: Continuation of a discussion of file system data structures.

item.description: Introduction to MLFQ, Con Kolivas, Linux development, and the Rotating Staircase Deadline Scheduler.

item.title: Simple Schedulers
item.description: An overview of simple schedulers including the know-nothings (random, round-robin) and oracle schedulers.

item.title: Introduction to Scheduling
item.description: Completion of a discussion of thread states followed by a motivation of the what, when and how of thread scheduling.

item.title: Threads and Thread Implementations
item.description: Introduction to the thread abstraction and discussion of different threading implementations.

item.title: Context Switching
item.description: The how and why of context switching.

item.title: Software Interrupts and Exceptions
item.description: Discussion of ways that applications can get the kernel's attention.

item.description: Introduction to the root of kernel privilege, interrupts and exception handling.

item.title: exec, wait and exit
item.description: Completion of the process interface including a discussion of exec, wait, and exit.

item.title: Synchronization Primitives and Problems
item.description: Continuation of an introduction to synchronization primitives and a discussion of several classic synchronization problems.

item.title: Synchronization Primitives
item.description: Completion of a discussion of critical sections, and an overview of locks and condition variables.

item.title: fork() and Synchronization
item.description: Completion of a discussion of fork including the use of pipes, and the beginning of a unit on synchronization.

item.description: Continuation of a discussion of the process abstraction and introduction to file handles and file descriptors.

item.description: Introduction to the process abstraction and standard UNIX utilities.

item.description: Introduction to an introduction to operating systems, the course staff, and course policies.
